Syllabus.Heading: Overview
Syllabus.Description: History, Importance, Basic Structure, Programming Style

Syllabus.Heading: Constants, Variables, and Data Types
Syllabus.Description: Character Set, C Tokens, Keywords, and Identifiers, Constants, Variables, Data Types, Declaration of Variables, Declaration of Storage Class, Assigning Values to Variables, Defining Symbolic Constants, Declaring a Variable as Constant, Declaring a Variable as Volatile, Overflow and Underflow of Data

Syllabus.Heading: Operators and Expressions
Syllabus.Description: Arithmetic, Relational, Logical, Assignment, Increment and Decrement, Conditional, Bitwise, Special Operators, Arithmetic Expressions, Evaluation of Expressions, Type Conversions in Expressions, Operator Precedence and Associativity, Mathematical Functions

Syllabus.Heading: Managing Input and Output Operations
Syllabus.Description: Reading a Character, Writing a Character, Formatted Input, Formatted Output

Syllabus.Heading: Decision Making and Branching
Syllabus.Description: Decision Making with IF Statement, Simple IF Statement, The IF ELSE Statement, Nesting of IF ELSE Statements, The ELSE IF Ladder, The Switch Statement, The ?: Operator, The GOTO Statement

Syllabus.Heading: Loop
Syllabus.Description: Looping Basic, Necessity of Loops, The WHILE Statement, The DO Statement, The FOR Statement, Jumps in LOOPS, Entry Controlled Loops, Exit Controlled Loops, Concise Test Expression, Formulating Problems Using Loops; Nested Loop: Nesting of Two Loops, Example, Nesting of Independent Loops inside One, Example, Nesting of More Than Two Loops

Syllabus.Heading: Arrays
Syllabus.Description: Introduction, One-dimensional (1D) Arrays, Declaration and initialization of 1D Arrays, Two-dimensional (2D) Arrays, Declaration and initialization of 2D Arrays, Accessing arrays through Loops, Multi-dimensional Array, Dynamic Arrays

Syllabus.Heading: Character Arrays and Strings
Syllabus.Description: Introduction, Declaring and Initializing String Variables, Difference between String and Character Array, I/O, Basic Operations without using Library Functions, Arithmetic Operations on Characters, String Library: Basic String Operations, Length, Compare, Concatenate, Substring, Reverse, String-handling Functions, Other Features of Strings

Syllabus.Heading: Functions-I
Syllabus.Description: Need for User-defined Functions, A Multi-function Program, Elements of User-defined Functions, Definition of Functions, Return Values and their Types, Function Calls, Function Declaration, Category of Functions, Local and Global Variables, No Arguments and no Return Values, All Arguments but no Return Values, Arguments with Return Values, No Arguments but Returns a Value, Functions that Return Multiple Values

Syllabus.Heading: Functions-II
Syllabus.Description: Nesting of Functions, Recursion, Passing Arrays to Functions, Passing Strings to Functions, The Scope, Visibility and Lifetime of Variables, Multi File Programs

Syllabus.Heading: Structures
Syllabus.Description: Basics, Necessity, Declaration, Accessing, Initialization, Arrays of Structures, Arrays within Structures, Structures and Functions

Syllabus.Heading: Pointers
Syllabus.Description: Understanding Pointers, Accessing the Address of a Variable, Declaring Pointer Variables, Initialization of Pointer Variables, Accessing a Variable through its Pointer, Chain of Pointers

Syllabus.Heading: Dynamic Memory Allocation
Syllabus.Description: Basics, Uses, Malloc, Free, Calloc, Realloc

Syllabus.Heading: File Management
Syllabus.Description: Basics, Uses, File Opening, Closing, File I/O, Use of Redirect Operator to Write in File or Read from File

Subjects.SubjectName: SE 103 : Basic Principles of Software Engineering
SE 103 (lab) : Basic Principles of Software Engineering
SEC 105 : Basic Principles of Cyber Security

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction
Syllabus.Description: Overview of Cyber Security, Importance of Cyber Security, Cyber Security Principles

Syllabus.Heading: Cyber Threats
Syllabus.Description: Types of Cyber Threats, Malware, Phishing, Social Engineering

Syllabus.Heading: Cyber Vulnerabilities
Syllabus.Description: Common Vulnerabilities, Vulnerability Assessment, Exploits

Syllabus.Heading: Cryptography Basics
Syllabus.Description: Introduction to Cryptography, Symmetric and Asymmetric Encryption, Hash Functions

Syllabus.Heading: Network Security
Syllabus.Description: Network Security Fundamentals, Firewalls, Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems

Syllabus.Heading: Access Control
Syllabus.Description: Authentication Methods, Authorization, Access Control Models

Syllabus.Heading: Security Policies
Syllabus.Description: Importance of Security Policies, Developing Security Policies, Policy Implementation

Syllabus.Heading: Risk Management
Syllabus.Description: Risk Assessment, Risk Mitigation Strategies, Incident Response

Syllabus.Heading: Security in Operating Systems
Syllabus.Description: Operating System Security Fundamentals, Patch Management, Secure Configuration

Syllabus.Heading: Web Security
Syllabus.Description: Securing Web Applications, Common Web Vulnerabilities, Secure Coding Practices

Syllabus.Heading: Cyber Attacks
Syllabus.Description: Introduction to DoS and DDoS Attacks, XSS, CSRF, SQL Injection, Biometric Bypass Techniques

Syllabus.Heading: Prevention of Cyber Attacks
Syllabus.Description: Preventing DoS and DDoS, Mitigating XSS and CSRF, Securing Databases against SQL Injection, Biometric Security Best Practices

Syllabus.Heading: Ethical and Legal Issues
Syllabus.Description: Cyber Laws, Ethical Hacking, Privacy Issues

Syllabus.Heading: Review and Project Presentations
Syllabus.Description: Review of Key Concepts, Student Presentations on Selected Topics, Course Summary and Q&A

Syllabus.Heading: Elements of Statistics
Syllabus.Description: Nature and scope; population and sample data, representation of statistical data, discrete and continuous variables

Syllabus.Heading: Central Limit Theorem
Syllabus.Description: Arithmetic mean, geometric mean, harmonic mean, median, mode

Syllabus.Heading: Measures of Dispersion
Syllabus.Description: Range, standard deviation, quartiles, deciles, percentiles, mean deviation, quartile deviation

Syllabus.Heading: Statistical Measures
Syllabus.Description: Coefficient of dispersion, coefficient of variation, measure of skewness, moments and kurtosis

Syllabus.Heading: Regression and Correlation
Syllabus.Description: Relationship between variables, fitting of regression lines, simple correlation

Syllabus.Heading: Multiple Correlation and Regression
Syllabus.Description: Correlation coefficient and regression coefficient

Syllabus.Heading: Elements of Probability
Syllabus.Description: Meaning and definition of probability, properties, basic terminology of probability, Bayes theorem, random variables, probability function

Syllabus.Heading: Probability Distribution Function
Syllabus.Description: Binomial distribution, Poisson distribution, normal distribution, standard normal distribution, t-distribution, confidence level, estimation

Syllabus.Heading: Mathematical Expectation
Syllabus.Description: Meaning of mathematical expectation, expected value of a function of a random variable, expected value of a function of two random variables

Syllabus.Heading: Fundamentals of Hypothesis Testing
Syllabus.Description: Fundamentals of hypothesis testing

Syllabus.Heading: t-test and ANOVA Test
Syllabus.Description: t-test and ANOVA test

Syllabus.Heading: Markov Model
Syllabus.Description: Markov Model

Syllabus.Heading: Stochastic Analysis
Syllabus.Description: Stochastic Analysis

Syllabus.Heading: Queuing Analysis
Syllabus.Description: Queuing system, system performance measures, Queuing model

Subjects.SubjectName: HIS 109 : History of the Emergence of Independent Bangladesh

Syllabus.Heading: Naming Bangladesh
Syllabus.Description: History of Ancient and Medieval Bangladesh (Land formation, early settlement, Maurya, Pala and Sena Empires)

Syllabus.Heading: History of Ancient and Medieval Bangladesh
Syllabus.Description: Arrival of the Muslims, Ilyas Shahi and Hussain Shahi dynasty, Mughal Encounters with Bara Bhuiyans, Nawabism

Syllabus.Heading: War of Plassey and British Colonial Rule
Syllabus.Description: 1757-1857; Sepoy Mutiny 1857

Syllabus.Heading: Nationalist Politics and Movement
Syllabus.Description: 1857-1930s: The Partition of Bengal and Formation of Muslim League, Swadeshi movement and Annulment of Partition of Bengal

Syllabus.Heading: Khilafat and Non-Cooperation Movements
Syllabus.Description: Morley-Minto reforms 1909 and Government of India act 1919 and 1935; 1937 Provincial Elections and Forms of Government

Syllabus.Heading: Lahore Resolution and Pakistan Movement
Syllabus.Description: 1930s-1947; Independent United Bengal Scheme; Indian Independence Act 1947: The partition of the subcontinent

Syllabus.Heading: Language Movement and National Identity
Syllabus.Description: The formation of Awami League; East Bengal Provincial Election in 1954 and the United Front

Syllabus.Heading: Movement Against Education Commission Report
Syllabus.Description: Disparity between two parts of Pakistan and the Six Point movement

Syllabus.Heading: Agartala Conspiracy Case
Syllabus.Description: 11-point movement of the students 1969; Mass upsurge of '69; General Election of 1970; Non-cooperation movement

Syllabus.Heading: Bangabandhu's Speech and Independence
Syllabus.Description: Crackdown and Genocide of March 25 and the beginning of the liberation war

Syllabus.Heading: Mujibnagar Government
Syllabus.Description: Liberation war: Freedom fighters and the sectors; Surrender of Pakistan Army

Syllabus.Heading: Role of Major Powers in 1971
Syllabus.Description: National and International media and the liberation war; Bangabandhu's return to Bangladesh

Syllabus.Heading: Nation Building
Syllabus.Description: Father of the Nation Bangabandhu Sheikh Mujibur Rahman and the early days of Bangladesh

Syllabus.Heading: Constitution of Bangladesh 1972
Syllabus.Description: Journey towards the Golden Bengal

Syllabus.Heading: Philosophy of Object-Oriented Programming
Syllabus.Description: Advantages of OOP over structured programming; Introduction to C++ and Java; Data Types, Variables, Operators, Function, Arguments & Overloading in C++

Syllabus.Heading: Encapsulation, Classes and Objects
Syllabus.Description: Access specifiers, Inline Member Function, Friend Function, The 'this' Keyword, static and non-static members; Constructors, destructors, and copy constructors

Syllabus.Heading: Union and Objects
Syllabus.Description: Array of objects, object pointers, and object references

Syllabus.Heading: Inheritance in C++
Syllabus.Description: Types of inheritance, Overriding Member Function

Syllabus.Heading: Polymorphism in C++
Syllabus.Description: Overloading, abstract classes, Virtual and Pure Virtual Function

Syllabus.Heading: Java Architecture
Syllabus.Description: Features of Java, Java Development Kit (JDK), Data Types, Operators & Control Structures in Java

Syllabus.Heading: Exception Handling
Syllabus.Description: Types of Exception, Throws, Try & Catch Blocks, finally clause

Syllabus.Heading: Object Oriented I/O
Syllabus.Description: Introduction to Stream, Bytes Stream & Character Stream, File, Filtered Bytes Stream, Object Serialization

Syllabus.Heading: Template Functions and Classes
Syllabus.Description: Template functions and classes

Syllabus.Heading: Multi-threaded Programming
Syllabus.Description: Using Multi-Threading and Multi-tasking, The Java Thread Model, Thread class and Runnable interface, Dead Lock

Syllabus.Heading: Generic Collections
Syllabus.Description: Generic Collections

Syllabus.Heading: Packages
Syllabus.Description: Packages

Syllabus.Heading: Applets & Application
Syllabus.Description: Java Applets, Java Application, Types of Java programs, Java Applets

Syllabus.Heading: AWT GUI Components
Syllabus.Description: Introduction About AWT, GUI Components, Java-AWT packages, Event Handling, Event Listener

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction
Syllabus.Description: Basic concepts of data structure, Abstract Data Types (ADT), Data structure classification, Basic operations on data structures, Algorithm: Definition, Characteristics, and Complexity

Syllabus.Heading: Array
Syllabus.Description: Linear Array, Representation of Linear array in memory, Traversing, Insertion, Deletion, Searching: Linear Search & Binary Search, Sorting: Bubble Sort, Insertion Sort, Selection sort, Multidimensional Array, Pointer Array, Record

Syllabus.Heading: Algorithm Complexity
Syllabus.Description: Preliminary idea of an algorithm, Asymptotic Notation, runtime complexity (Big Oh notation), the preliminary idea of data structure space complexity, Trade of Time & Space complexity

Syllabus.Heading: Solving Recurrences
Syllabus.Description: Recursion Tree, Substitution Method, Master Method

Syllabus.Heading: Methods for Designing Efficient Algorithms
Syllabus.Description: Divide and conquer, Greedy method, Dynamic programming; Backtracking, etc.

Syllabus.Heading: Linked List
Syllabus.Description: Representation of Linked Lists, Singly/doubly/circular linked lists, basic operations on linked lists (insertion, deletion, traverse, and searching). Header and two-way linked lists

Syllabus.Heading: Stack
Syllabus.Description: Basic stack operations (push/pop/peek), stack-class implementation using Array and linked list, in-fix to postfix expressions conversion and evaluation, balancing parentheses using stack

Syllabus.Heading: Queue and Recursion
Syllabus.Description: Basic queue operations (enqueue, dequeue), circular queue/ dequeue, queue-class implementation using array and linked list, Priority queue application- Josephus problem, palindrome checker using stack and queue, Recursion: Basic idea of recursion (3 law cases, call itself, move towards the base case by state change), tracing output of a recursive function, applications- merge sort, permutation, combination

Syllabus.Heading: Tree (Part 1)
Syllabus.Description: General Tree: Implementation, application of general tree- file system. Binary Tree: Binary tree representation using array and pointers, traversal of Binary Tree (in-order, pre-order, and postorder), BST representation, basic operations on BST (creation, insertion, deletion, querying, and traversing)

Syllabus.Heading: Tree (Part 2)
Syllabus.Description: Huffman Tree, Huffman Coding: application- searching, sets, Heap: Min-heap, max-heap, Fibonacci-heap, applications- priority queue, Self-balancing Binary Search Tree: AVL tree (rotation, insertion); B Tree; Red Black Tree

Syllabus.Heading: Graph (Part 1)
Syllabus.Description: Graph representation (adjacency matrix/adjacency list), basic operations on graph (node/edge insertion and deletion), traversing a graph: breadth-first search (BFS)

Syllabus.Heading: Graph (Part 2)
Syllabus.Description: Depth-first search (DFS), Topological Sort, Floyd Warshall's Algorithm, Minimum Spanning Tree

Syllabus.Heading: Sorting and Set Operations
Syllabus.Description: Sorting: merge sort, quick sort. Set Operations: Set representation using bitmask, set/clear bit, querying the status of a bit, toggling bit values, LSB, and application of set operations

Syllabus.Heading: Disjoint Set and String ADT
Syllabus.Description: Disjoint Set: Union, find, path compression. String ADT: The concatenation of two strings, extracting substrings, searching a string for a matching substring, and parsing

Subjects.SubjectName: CSE 115 : Discrete Mathematics and Graph Theory

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction
Syllabus.Description: Introduction to Discrete Mathematics, Propositional Logic, Logical Connectives, Truth Tables

Syllabus.Heading: Methods of Proof
Syllabus.Description: Direct Proof, Indirect Proof, Proof by Contradiction, Proof by Contrapositive

Syllabus.Heading: Set Theory
Syllabus.Description: Introduction to Sets, Venn Diagrams, Set Operations, Cartesian Products

Syllabus.Heading: Functions and Relations
Syllabus.Description: Definitions and Types, Injective, Surjective, and Bijective Functions, Definitions and Types of Relations, Properties of Relations

Syllabus.Heading: Counting Principles
Syllabus.Description: Basic Counting Principles, Permutations, Combinations, Binomial Theorem

Syllabus.Heading: Advanced Counting Techniques
Syllabus.Description: Pigeonhole Principle, Inclusion-Exclusion Principle, Recurrence Relations

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction to Graph Theory
Syllabus.Description: Graphs Definitions and Types, Graph Representations, Adjacency Matrices and Lists, Incidence Matrices

Syllabus.Heading: Graph Properties and Types
Syllabus.Description: Degree of a Vertex, Paths and Cycles, Connected Graphs, Bipartite Graphs

Syllabus.Heading: Counting Techniques
Syllabus.Description: Counting Words Made with Elements of a Set S, Counting Words with Distinct Letters Made with Elements of a Set S, Counting Words Where Letters May Repeat, Counting Subsets, Pascal's Identity and Its Combinatorial Applications

Syllabus.Heading: Planar Graphs and Graph Coloring
Syllabus.Description: Planarity, Euler's Formula, Graph Coloring, Chromatic Number

Syllabus.Heading: Graph Algorithms
Syllabus.Description: Kruskal's Algorithm for Minimum Spanning Tree, Prim's Algorithm for Minimum Spanning Tree, Floyd-Warshall Algorithm for All-Pairs Shortest Paths, Bellman-Ford Algorithm for Shortest Path

Syllabus.Heading: Mathematical Structures
Syllabus.Description: Introduction to Algebraic Structures, Groups, Rings, and Fields, Lattices and Boolean Algebras

Syllabus.Heading: Applications of Discrete Mathematics
Syllabus.Description: Cryptography, Network Models, Coding Theory

Syllabus.Heading: Review and Project Presentations
Syllabus.Description: Review of Key Concepts, Student Presentations on Selected Topics, Course Summary and Q&A

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction to the System Analyst and Information System Development
Syllabus.Description: The Systems Analyst, Systems Development Life Cycle, Project Identification and Initiation, Feasibility Analysis

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction to Project Selection and Management
Syllabus.Description: Project Selection, Creating the Project Plan, Staffing the Project, Managing and Controlling the Project, Applying The Concepts At Tune Source

Syllabus.Heading: Requirements Determination
Syllabus.Description: Requirements elicitation Techniques, Requirements Analysis Strategies

Syllabus.Heading: Use Cases Analysis
Syllabus.Description: Elements of a Use Case, Use Cases and the Functional Requirements, Building Use Cases, Identifying the Major Use Cases

Syllabus.Heading: Data Flow Diagrams
Syllabus.Description: Elements of Data Flow Diagrams, Using Data Flow Diagrams to Define Business Processes, Creating Data Flow Diagrams, Creating Data Flow Diagram Fragments, Creating the Level 0 Data Flow Diagram, Creating Level 1 Data Flow Diagrams (and below), Validating the Data Flow Diagrams

Syllabus.Heading: The Entity Relationship Diagram
Syllabus.Description: Reading an Entity Relationship Diagram, Elements of an Entity Relationship Diagram, The Data Dictionary and Metadata, Building Entity Relationship Diagrams, Advanced Syntax

Syllabus.Heading: Transition from Requirements to Design
Syllabus.Description: System Acquisition Strategies, Influences on the Acquisition Strategy, Selecting an Acquisition Strategy

Syllabus.Heading: Elements of an Architecture Design
Syllabus.Description: Creating an Architecture Design, Hardware and Software Specification

Syllabus.Heading: Principles for User Interface Design
Syllabus.Description: User Interface Design Process, Navigation Design, Input Design, Output Design

Syllabus.Heading: The Physical Data Flow Diagram
Syllabus.Description: Designing Programs, Structure Chart, Program Specification

Syllabus.Heading: Data Storage Formats
Syllabus.Description: Moving from Logical to Physical Data Models, Optimizing Data Storage

Syllabus.Heading: Managing the Programming Process
Syllabus.Description: Testing, Developing Documentation

Syllabus.Heading: Making the Transition to the New System
Syllabus.Description: The Migration Plan, Postimplementation Activities

Syllabus.Heading: Basic Characteristics of Object-Oriented Systems
Syllabus.Description: Object-Oriented Systems Analysis and Design, Use Case Diagram, Class Diagram, Sequence Diagram, Behavioral State Machine Diagram

Syllabus.Heading: Preliminaries of Computing
Syllabus.Description: Basic concepts, Floating point arithmetic, Types of errors and their computation, Convergence

Syllabus.Heading: Numerical Solution of Non-linear and Transcendental Equations
Syllabus.Description: Bisection method, Method of false position, Fixed point iteration, Newton-Raphson method

Syllabus.Heading: Interpolation and Polynomial Approximation
Syllabus.Description: Polynomial interpolation theory, Finite differences and their table, Taylor polynomials, Newton's Interpolation, Lagrange polynomials

Syllabus.Heading: Numerical Differentiation and Integration (Part 1)
Syllabus.Description: Numerical differentiation, Richardson's extrapolation

Syllabus.Heading: Numerical Differentiation and Integration (Part 2)
Syllabus.Description: Elements of Numerical Integration, Trapezoidal, Simpson's, Weddle's, etc., Adaptive quadrature method

Syllabus.Heading: Numerical Solutions of Linear Systems
Syllabus.Description: Direct methods for solving linear systems, Gaussian elimination and backward substitution, pivoting strategies, numerical factorizations

Syllabus.Heading: Iterative Methods
Syllabus.Description: Jacobi method, Gauss-Seidel method, and their convergence analysis

Syllabus.Heading: Curve Fitting and Approximation
Syllabus.Description: Spline Interpolation and Cubic Splines, Least Squares Approximation

Syllabus.Heading: Approximating Eigenvalues
Syllabus.Description: Eigenvalues and eigenvectors, the power method, Convergence of Power method, Inverse Power method

Syllabus.Heading: Nonlinear System of Equations (Part 1)
Syllabus.Description: Fixed point for functions of several variables, Newton's method, Quasi-Newton's method

Syllabus.Heading: Nonlinear System of Equations (Part 2)
Syllabus.Description: Conjugate Gradient Method, Steepest Descent techniques

Syllabus.Heading: Initial Value Problems for ODE (Single-step Methods)
Syllabus.Description: Euler's and modified Euler's method, Higher order Taylor's method, and Runge-Kutta methods

Syllabus.Heading: Boundary Value Problem for ODE (Part 1)
Syllabus.Description: Shooting method for linear and nonlinear problems

Syllabus.Heading: Boundary Value Problem for ODE (Part 2)
Syllabus.Description: Finite difference methods for linear and nonlinear problems

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction
Syllabus.Description: Overview of Database Systems, Comparison with Traditional File Systems

Syllabus.Heading: Data Models
Syllabus.Description: Entity-Relationship (ER) Model, Entities, Attributes, Relationships, ER Diagrams

Syllabus.Heading: Relational Model
Syllabus.Description: Structure of Relational Databases, Relations, Tuples

Syllabus.Heading: Query Languages
Syllabus.Description: Introduction to Relational Algebra, Basic Operations

Syllabus.Heading: SQL
Syllabus.Description: Basics of SQL, Creating and Managing Tables, Simple Queries

Syllabus.Heading: Intermediate SQL
Syllabus.Description: Joins, Subqueries, Aggregation, and Grouping

Syllabus.Heading: Constraints and Triggers
Syllabus.Description: Integrity Constraints, Creating and Using Triggers

Syllabus.Heading: Functional Dependencies and Normalization
Syllabus.Description: Understanding Dependencies, Normal Forms, Normalization Process

Syllabus.Heading: File Organization and Data Storage
Syllabus.Description: File Structures, Data Storage Techniques, Buffer Management

Syllabus.Heading: Indexing and Hashing
Syllabus.Description: Index Structures, B-Trees, Hash Functions, Index Maintenance

Syllabus.Heading: Query Optimization
Syllabus.Description: Techniques for Optimizing Queries, Cost-Based Optimization

Syllabus.Heading: Transaction Management
Syllabus.Description: ACID Properties, Transaction States, Serializability

Syllabus.Heading: Concurrency Control
Syllabus.Description: Locking Mechanisms, Deadlock Handling, Isolation Levels

Syllabus.Heading: Recovery Mechanisms and Advanced Topics
Syllabus.Description: Recovery Techniques, Object-Based Databases, Semi-Structured Databases

Subjects.SubjectName: CSE 203 : Operating System and Unix Programming

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction and Operating System Concepts
Syllabus.Description: OS Concepts, Functions, Types of OS, OS Structures

Syllabus.Heading: Processes and Threads
Syllabus.Description: Process management, thread concepts, and scheduling

Syllabus.Heading: Memory Management
Syllabus.Description: Memory allocation, paging, segmentation, virtual memory

Syllabus.Heading: File Systems
Syllabus.Description: File system structure, access methods, and management

Syllabus.Heading: Input/Output, Deadlocks
Syllabus.Description: I/O management, deadlock detection, and prevention

Syllabus.Heading: Unix Programming
Syllabus.Description: Basic Unix commands, shell scripting, and system calls

Syllabus.Heading: Unix Programming
Syllabus.Description: Advanced Unix programming, process control, and inter-process communication

Syllabus.Heading: Virtualization and the Cloud
Syllabus.Description: Concepts of virtualization, cloud computing, and their relation to OS

Syllabus.Heading: Multiple Processor Systems
Syllabus.Description: Multiprocessing, parallel computing, and OS support

Syllabus.Heading: Security
Syllabus.Description: OS security mechanisms, authentication, and access control

Syllabus.Heading: Embedded Operating System
Syllabus.Description: OS design for embedded systems and real-time applications

Syllabus.Heading: Operating System Design
Syllabus.Description: Principles and techniques for designing operating systems

Syllabus.Heading: Distributed Home Automation System
Syllabus.Description: OS support for distributed systems, focusing on home automation

PROG 211 : Android and Web Application Development

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction to Android App Development
Syllabus.Description: Welcome to Android Ville, The Android platform dissected, applications of Android development

Syllabus.Heading: Android Fundamentals
Syllabus.Description: Development environment, install IDE, Useful files in a project, Creating an Android Virtual Device, Building first app

Syllabus.Description: Introducing various Activities, Intents, and Fragments, List views, the importance of those functionalities and their implementation

Syllabus.Description: Requirement Engineering for Web Applications, Web Application Architectures, Design Principles of Web-based Applications

Syllabus.Description: Introduction to Client-side technology with HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, JavaScript, AJAX and ReactJS

Syllabus.Heading: Server-side technologies
Syllabus.Description: Approaches to running Server Programs, The Classic Technology: Common Gateway Interface (CGI): Definition, Characteristics, Introduction to PHP Programming, Introduction to FASTAPI

Syllabus.Description: Web Application Security, Testing and Quality Assurance, Operations & Maintenance of Web Applications

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction

Syllabus.Heading: Modeling Techniques

Syllabus.Heading: Requirements Validation

Syllabus.Heading: Linear Algebra
Syllabus.Description: Solution of a system of linear equations, Gaussian elimination, Gauss-Jordan elimination

Syllabus.Heading: Linear Algebra
Syllabus.Description: Dimension, rank, and nullity

Syllabus.Heading: Linear Algebra
Syllabus.Description: Elementary transformations of matrices, matrix polynomials, linear span, linear independence, linear dependence, coordinates, and bases

Syllabus.Heading: Linear Algebra
Syllabus.Description: Vector product, scalar product, scalar triple product, vector triple product, eigenvalues, and eigenvectors

Syllabus.Heading: Linear Algebra
Syllabus.Description: LU factorization, singular value decomposition

Syllabus.Heading: Complex Variable
Syllabus.Description: Complex numbers and their geometric representation, polar form of complex numbers, powers, and roots

Syllabus.Heading: Complex Variable
Syllabus.Description: Derivative, analytic function, Cauchy-Riemann equations

Syllabus.Heading: Laplace Transform
Syllabus.Description: Laplace transforms and basic theorems on Laplace transform

Syllabus.Heading: Laplace Transform
Syllabus.Description: Inverse Laplace transforms elementary functions, convolution theorem

Syllabus.Heading: Laplace Transform
Syllabus.Description: Application of Laplace transforms to the solution of differential equations and system of differential equations

Syllabus.Heading: Fourier Analysis
Syllabus.Description: Fourier series and transform

Syllabus.Heading: Fourier Analysis
Syllabus.Description: Fourier coefficients, odd and even functions

Syllabus.Heading: Fourier Analysis
Syllabus.Description: The complex form of Fourier Transformation and series

Syllabus.Heading: Fourier Analysis
Syllabus.Description: Applications of Fourier Series and Transformation

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction to Distributed Databases
Syllabus.Description: Definition of Distributed Databases and Distributed Database Management System (DDBMS), Understanding the concept of Distributed Transparent Systems, Overview of DDBMS Architecture: DBMS Standardization, Global, Local, External, and Internal Schemas

Syllabus.Heading: Distributed Database Design
Syllabus.Description: Exploring design problems in Distributed Systems, Analysis of Design Strategies: Top-Down and Bottom-Up Approaches, Understanding Fragmentation, Allocation, and Replication of Fragments in Distributed Databases

Syllabus.Heading: Query Processing
Syllabus.Description: Overview of Query Processing in Distributed Databases, Importance of Query Optimization in Distributed Environments

Syllabus.Heading: Transaction Management in Distributed Databases
Syllabus.Description: Definition and Examples of Transactions, Formalization of Transactions and ACID Properties, Classification of Transactions

Syllabus.Heading: Concurrency Control in Distributed Databases
Syllabus.Description: Understanding Concurrency Control mechanisms, Execution Schedules and Examples, Exploring Locking-based and Timestamp Ordering Algorithms

Syllabus.Heading: DBMS Reliability in Distributed Systems
Syllabus.Description: Definitions and Basic Concepts, Local Recovery Management, In-place and Out-of-place Update Strategies

Syllabus.Heading: Distributed Reliability Protocols
Syllabus.Description: Two-Phase Commit Protocol, Three-Phase Commit Protocol, Deadlock Management Techniques

Syllabus.Heading: Parallel Database Systems
Syllabus.Description: Introduction to Parallel Database Systems, Speed-up and Scale-up in Parallel Query Evaluation

Syllabus.Heading: Parallel Query Evaluation Techniques
Syllabus.Description: Understanding I/O Parallelism (Data Partitioning), Exploring Intra-query and Inter-query Parallelism

Syllabus.Heading: Database Systems Architectures
Syllabus.Description: Comparison between Row Stores and Column Stores, Understanding OLTP vs. OLAP Systems, Introduction to In-Memory Database Systems

Syllabus.Heading: Data Models in Distributed Databases
Syllabus.Description: Analysis of Relational, Object-Oriented, and NoSQL Data Models, Importance of Data Modeling in Distributed Environments

Syllabus.Heading: Indexing Techniques
Syllabus.Description: Tree-based and Hash-based Indexing, Multidimensional Indexing, Learning Indices from Data

Syllabus.Heading: Write-Optimized Data Structures
Syllabus.Description: Exploring LSM Trees, LSM Hash Tables, B Trees, Understanding their Role in Database Optimization

Syllabus.Heading: Advanced Database Applications
Syllabus.Description: Data Warehousing and Decision Support Systems: OLAP, Materialized Views, Incremental View Maintenance, Stream Processing Systems and Data Streaming Algorithms, Database Systems for Scientific (Array) Databases, Cloud Databases, and Machine Learning, Overview of Deductive, Active, Multimedia, and XML Databases

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction to Software Architecture and Design
Syllabus.Description: Introduction to Software Architecture, Introduction to Software Design, Design Vs. Architecture

Syllabus.Heading: Software Architecture Core Concepts
Syllabus.Description: Define Software Architecture, Architecture Address NFR, Architectures and Technologies

Syllabus.Heading: Software Architecture Business Cycle
Syllabus.Description: Where do architecture comes from, Software process and architecture business cycle, what makes a good architecture

Syllabus.Heading: Software Architecture Business Cycle
Syllabus.Description: Activities in software process and architecture business cycle, Architectural Structures and views

Syllabus.Heading: Quality Attributes in Software Architecture
Syllabus.Description: Motivation, what are the different Quantity attributes, Performance, Scalability, Modifiability, Security, Availability, Robustness, How to Achieve quality attributes at architectural level

Syllabus.Heading: Software Architecture Process
Syllabus.Description: Process Outline, Architecture Design, Validation

Syllabus.Heading: Case Study
Syllabus.Description: Architecture Patterns, Structural View, Behavioral View, Implementation Issues

Syllabus.Heading: Documenting Software Architecture
Syllabus.Description: Architecture Requirements, Solution Architecture Analysis

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction to design
Syllabus.Description: Introduction to Unified modelling language (UML)

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction to design
Syllabus.Description: Structural and behavioral diagrams

Syllabus.Heading: Modeling structural and behavioral diagram
Syllabus.Description: Modeling structural (class diagram) and behavioral diagram (use case, sequence diagram and state machine diagram) of online shopping application

Syllabus.Heading: Distributed File System
Syllabus.Description: Architecture, Process, Communication, Naming, Synchronization, Fault tolerance and Security, Introduction to Software Product Line engineering

Syllabus.Heading: Aspect Oriented Architecture
Syllabus.Description: Introduction to Aspect-Oriented Programming, Aspect oriented architecture, Aspect oriented Modelling using UML, Aspect Oriented Modelling tools

Syllabus.Heading: Model-Driven Architecture
Syllabus.Description: What is MDA, Why MDA, State of the Art Practices and Tools, Scaling a software architecture and design

Syllabus.Heading: Internetworking Basics
Syllabus.Description: Overview of Internetworking Models, OSI Reference Model, Ethernet Networking, Data Encapsulation, Cisco Three-Layer Hierarchical Model

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction to TCP/IP
Syllabus.Description: TCP/IP and the DoD Model, IP Addressing, Broadcast Addresses

Syllabus.Heading: Subnetting and VLSMs
Syllabus.Description: Subnetting Basics, Variable Length Subnet Masks (VLSMs), Summarization, Troubleshooting IP Addressing

Syllabus.Heading: Cisco IOS and SDM
Syllabus.Description: IOS User Interface, Command-Line Interface (CLI), Router and Switch Configurations, Saving and Erasing Configurations, Cisco Security Device Manager (SDM)

Syllabus.Heading: Managing a Cisco Internetwork
Syllabus.Description: Cisco Router Internal Components, Router Boot Sequence, Configuration Register Management, Backing Up and Restoring IOS and Configuration, Cisco Discovery Protocol (CDP), Telnet Usage, Hostname Resolution, Network Troubleshooting

Syllabus.Heading: IP Routing Basics
Syllabus.Description: Routing Process Overview, Configuring IP Routing, Dynamic Routing Concepts, Distance-Vector Routing Protocols (RIP), Interior Gateway Routing Protocol (IGRP), Configuration Verification

Syllabus.Heading: Enhanced IGRP (EIGRP) and OSPF
Syllabus.Description: EIGRP Features and Operation, Configuration for Large Networks, Load Balancing with EIGRP, OSPF Basics, Configuration, DR/BDR Elections, OSPF and Loopback Interfaces, Troubleshooting

Syllabus.Heading: Layer 2 Switching and STP
Syllabus.Description: Switching Services Overview, Spanning Tree Protocol (STP), Catalyst Switch Configuration, Cisco Network Assistant (CNA)

Syllabus.Heading: Virtual LANs (VLANs)
Syllabus.Description: VLAN Basics, VLAN Memberships, VLAN Identification, VLAN Trunking Protocol (VTP), Inter-VLAN Routing Configuration, Voice VLAN Configuration using CNA

Syllabus.Heading: Network Security
Syllabus.Description: Perimeter, Firewall, Internal Routers, Security Threat Recognition, Mitigation Strategies, Introduction to Access Lists (Standard, Extended, Advanced), Access List Monitoring, Configuration using SDM

Syllabus.Heading: Network Address Translation (NAT)
Syllabus.Description: NAT Overview, Types, NAT Operation, NAT Testing and Troubleshooting, NAT Configuration on Internetwork, Configuration using SDM

Syllabus.Heading: Cisco Wireless Technologies
Syllabus.Description: Introduction to Wireless Technology, Cisco Unified Wireless Solution, Wireless Internetwork Configuration

Syllabus.Heading: Internet Protocol Version 6 (IPv6)
Syllabus.Description: IPv6 Necessity and Benefits, Addressing, Operation in Internetworks, IPv6 Routing Protocols, Migration Strategies, IPv6 Configuration

Syllabus.Heading: Wide Area Networks
Syllabus.Description: Overview of Wide Area Networks, Cable and DSL Technologies, Serial WAN Cabling, High-Level Data-Link Control (HDLC), Point-to-Point Protocol (PPP), Frame Relay, SDM for WAN Configuration, Virtual Private Networks (VPNs). Case study on WAN connections

Subjects.SubjectName: CSE 219 : Industrial Revolutions and Emerging Technologies

Syllabus.Heading: Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
Syllabus.Description: Fundamental concepts, algorithms, and applications of AI and ML

Syllabus.Heading: Human-centered AI, Robotic Process Automation (RPA)
Syllabus.Description: AI designed for human interaction, automation of repetitive tasks using RPA

Syllabus.Heading: Extended Reality
Syllabus.Description: Virtual Reality, Augmented Reality, Mixed Reality and their applications

Syllabus.Heading: Big Data Analytics
Syllabus.Description: Techniques and tools for processing and analyzing large datasets

Syllabus.Heading: 3D Printing
Syllabus.Description: Principles, technologies, and applications of additive manufacturing

Syllabus.Heading: Genomics
Syllabus.Description: Study of genomes, sequencing technologies, and their impact on healthcare and biotechnology

Syllabus.Heading: Edge Computing
Syllabus.Description: Processing data closer to the source, reducing latency and bandwidth usage

Syllabus.Heading: Quantum Computing
Syllabus.Description: Principles of quantum mechanics in computing, potential applications

Syllabus.Heading: Blockchain
Syllabus.Description: Distributed ledger technology, applications in finance, supply chain, and beyond

Syllabus.Heading: Internet of Things (IoT)
Syllabus.Description: Network of interconnected devices, IoT architectures, and applications

Syllabus.Heading: Cyber Security
Syllabus.Description: Protecting systems and data from cyber threats, security frameworks and practices

Syllabus.Heading: 5G network and beyond
Syllabus.Description: Next-generation network technologies, their capabilities, and future trends

Syllabus.Heading: Supervisor and Topic Selection
Syllabus.Description: Application for Capstone Project Supervisor Selection, Topic and Supervisor selection, to be completed before the start of the 5th semester.

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction and Briefing
Syllabus.Description: Introduction to the Capstone Project, including objectives and expectations, conducted in Week 1.

Syllabus.Heading: Team Formation and Project Area Selection
Syllabus.Description: Formation of project teams and selection of project area, conducted in Week 2.

Syllabus.Heading: Conduct Investigation/Literature Review
Syllabus.Description: Conducting a literature review on the selected topic to establish the project's foundation.

Syllabus.Heading: Set Project Plan and Strategy
Syllabus.Description: Developing a project plan and strategy, including timelines and deliverables.

Syllabus.Heading: Preparation of Project Proposal
Syllabus.Description: Drafting the project proposal outlining the scope, objectives, and methodology.

Syllabus.Heading: Proposal Submission and Pre-Viva
Syllabus.Description: Submission of the project proposal and pre-viva evaluation by the supervisor (5% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor).

Syllabus.Heading: Review and Correction of Proposal
Syllabus.Description: Reviewing feedback and making corrections to the project proposal.

Syllabus.Heading: Document Preparation
Syllabus.Description: Preparing project documentation, including progress reports and other required materials.

Syllabus.Heading: Submission of Progress Report and Presentation
Syllabus.Description: Submission of progress report (10% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor and Defense Board) and progress presentation (5% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor and Defense Board). Continuous Assessment (30% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor) and Log Book (5% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor) are also part of the evaluation.

Subjects.SubjectName: PROG 301 : Advanced Programming with Python and Scripting

Syllabus.Heading: Python Structure
Syllabus.Description: Module, package, and scope. Control flow, loop, context manager, Object reference and recycling. Typing as type basic hinting.

Syllabus.Heading: Functional Programming
Syllabus.Description: Function and lambdas. Comprehensions. Closure and decorators. Generators and coroutine. Map, filter, Commands and itertools.

Syllabus.Heading: Object Oriented Programming
Syllabus.Description: Class and Object. Interface, Protocols and ABCs. Inheritance and advanced typing. Magic functions and operator overloading. Data class and pydantic.

Syllabus.Heading: Handling Command Line Arguments
Syllabus.Description: Handling command line arguments with perverse. Introduction to logging, pipes, and signal. File and directory management. Introduction to os and sys module. Networking: Sockets and addresses. TCP, UDP. Introduction to Paho: MQTT and SSL.

Syllabus.Heading: Threading and Multiprocessing
Syllabus.Description: Threading module, queue module, GIL in Python. Multiprocessing module, process pool, shared memory.

Syllabus.Heading: Asynchronous Programming
Syllabus.Description: The asyncio module, event loop, coroutine, and task.

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction to NumPy
Syllabus.Description: Data Type, Arrays, Universal Functions, Aggregation, Broadcasting, Indexing.

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction to Pandas
Syllabus.Description: Series, dataframe. Indexing (simple, hierarchical), selection. Join, merge, concat, append. Aggregation and grouping. Pivot table.

Syllabus.Heading: Data Visualization using Matplotlib
Syllabus.Description: Line plot, scatter plot, density and contour plot, subplot, legend, test and annotation, 3D plotting.

Syllabus.Heading: Machine Learning with Scikit-learn, TensorFlow
Syllabus.Description: Data representation in scikit-learn. Hyperparameters and model validation. TensorFlow basics, Keras APIs, and Tensorboard visualization.

Syllabus.Heading: Web Scraping with Beautiful Soup
Syllabus.Description: Introduction to request and urllib module. Working with JSON.

Syllabus.Heading: Web Development with FastAPI/Django
Syllabus.Description: Building web applications using FastAPI or Django frameworks.

Subjects.SubjectName: PROG 301 (lab) : Advanced Programming with Python and Scripting

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction to Distributed Computing Architectures
Syllabus.Description: Overview of distributed computing architectures, paradigms, and Service-Oriented Architecture.

Syllabus.Heading: Computing Paradigm and Software Design Patterns
Syllabus.Description: Study of computing paradigms and software design patterns, including Software Structural Patterns and Software Behavior Patterns.

Syllabus.Heading: Programming in Concurrency Patterns and Multithreading
Syllabus.Description: Techniques for programming with concurrency patterns and multithreading in distributed systems.

Syllabus.Heading: Performance under Multi-Core and Hyper-Threading Support
Syllabus.Description: Optimizing performance in distributed systems using multi-core and hyper-threading technologies.

Syllabus.Heading: Service-Oriented Software Development
Syllabus.Description: Developing service-oriented software using WSDL, SOAP, Restful Services, Service Provider, and Service Broker.

Syllabus.Heading: Service Hosting and Structural Patterns
Syllabus.Description: Service hosting, Service Client, and exercising Software Structural Patterns (Adapter, Faade, Composite, Decorator Design Patterns).

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction to Software Project Management
Syllabus.Description: Role and importance of project management in software development.

Syllabus.Heading: Project Initiation and Feasibility Analysis
Syllabus.Description: Conducting feasibility studies and defining project scope.

Syllabus.Heading: Project Planning: Scope, Schedule, and Resources
Syllabus.Description: Creating project plans, defining milestones, and allocating resources.

Syllabus.Heading: Agile Methodologies: Scrum Basics
Syllabus.Description: Fundamentals of Scrum, roles (Product Owner, Scrum Master, Team).

Syllabus.Heading: Agile Methodologies: Sprint Planning and Execution
Syllabus.Description: Understanding sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and sprint reviews.

Syllabus.Heading: Agile Methodologies: Kanban and Lean
Syllabus.Description: Exploring Kanban boards and lean principles in software projects.

Syllabus.Heading: Risk Management in Software Projects
Syllabus.Description: Identifying, assessing, and managing risks throughout the project lifecycle.

Syllabus.Heading: Quality Assurance and Testing
Syllabus.Description: Implementing QA processes, testing strategies, and bug tracking.

Syllabus.Heading: Project Monitoring and Control
Syllabus.Description: Monitoring project progress, tracking metrics, and adapting plans as needed.

Syllabus.Heading: Stakeholder Management and Communication
Syllabus.Description: Effective communication with stakeholders and managing expectations.

Syllabus.Heading: Project Closure and Post-Implementation Review
Syllabus.Description: Conducting project closure activities and lessons learned sessions.

Syllabus.Heading: Software Metrics and Performance Measurement
Syllabus.Description: Measuring project performance and software metrics for continuous improvement.

Syllabus.Heading: Emerging Trends in Software Project Management
Syllabus.Description: Exploring current trends like DevOps, AI in project management, etc.

Syllabus.Heading: Final Project Presentations
Syllabus.Description: Presenting project outcomes, lessons learned, and future recommendations.

Subjects.SubjectName: SE 307 : Software Testing and Quality Assurance

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction to Software Quality and Quality Assurance Tasks
Syllabus.Description: Software quality, Elements of software quality assurance, SQA tasks, goals, and metrics, Software quality standards (ISO, IEEE, etc.), Software quality assurance throughout software life cycle, Testing vs. Software quality assurance.

Syllabus.Heading: Testing Background
Syllabus.Description: Software testing: A bigger picture, Testing levels of Verification and Validation of Testing Strategies, Testing matrices, Testing throughout the software life cycle, Test case, Anatomy of a test case, Managing test cases.

Syllabus.Heading: Functional Testing (Black-Box Testing)
Syllabus.Description: Equivalent partition, Boundary value analysis.

Syllabus.Heading: Functional Testing (Black-Box Testing)
Syllabus.Description: Boundary value analysis, Use-case based testing.

Syllabus.Heading: Bug Management
Syllabus.Description: Effective bug reporting, the bug workflow, Tracking bugs.

Syllabus.Heading: Model-based Testing
Syllabus.Description: Testing with models, Finite state machine model testing.

Syllabus.Heading: Structure Based Testing Techniques (White-Box Testing)
Syllabus.Description: Introduction, Path coverage and McCabe Cyclomatic complexity, Control structure coverage, Combinations of conditions.

Syllabus.Heading: Structure Based Testing Techniques (White-Box Testing)
Syllabus.Description: Data path testing, Automated unit testing and Test-driven development.

Syllabus.Heading: Testing Object Oriented Applications
Syllabus.Description: Design of object-oriented applications and Testability, Test-cases and class hierarchy, use case-based test design, State based testing, Inter-class testing.

Syllabus.Heading: Code Matrices and Testability of a Program
Syllabus.Description: Introduction, Refactoring and regression testing.

Syllabus.Heading: Integration Testing
Syllabus.Description: Various approaches used for integration testing including, Incremental, Top-Down, Bottom Up, Smoke, Sandwich, and Regression testing.

Syllabus.Heading: Testing Web Applications
Syllabus.Description: Quality dimensions of web applications, Errors within web application environments, User interface testing, Content Testing, Component testing, Performance Testing, Configuration testing.

Syllabus.Heading: Testing SOA Applications
Syllabus.Description: Testing services, Deployment testing, Integration Testing, Model-based SOA application testing using pertinent modeling.

Syllabus.Heading: Software Quality Control Beyond Testing
Syllabus.Description: Requirement Based Testing Techniques Validation: Alpha, Beta, and Acceptance testing Inspections, Reviews, and Walkthroughs, Defects prevention and process improvements, Comparison of quality assurance techniques.

Subjects.SubjectName: SE 307 (lab) : Software Testing and Quality Assurance

Syllabus.Heading: Finalize the Methodology
Syllabus.Description: Finalizing the project methodology, including research and development approaches, conducted in Weeks 1-2. Continuous Assessment (30% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor) applies.

Syllabus.Heading: Development and Implementation of Project Prototype
Syllabus.Description: Developing and implementing the project prototype, conducted in Weeks 3-4. Continuous Assessment (30% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor) and Log Book (5% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor) are part of the evaluation.

Syllabus.Heading: Field Work/Data Collection/Analysis/Software Development
Syllabus.Description: Conducting field work, data collection, analysis, and related software development, conducted in Weeks 5-8. Continuous Assessment (30% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor) and Log Book (5% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor) apply.

Syllabus.Heading: Project Fine Tuning
Syllabus.Description: Fine-tuning the project based on initial results and feedback, conducted in Weeks 9-10. Continuous Assessment (30% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor) applies.

Syllabus.Heading: Report Writing
Syllabus.Description: Writing the project report, documenting methodology, findings, and analysis, conducted in Weeks 1-10. Continuous Assessment (30% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor) applies.

Syllabus.Heading: Submission of Draft Report and Pre-review
Syllabus.Description: Submission of the draft project report and pre-review by the supervisor, conducted in Week 11. Continuous Assessment (30% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor) applies.

Syllabus.Heading: Submission of Final Report
Syllabus.Description: Submission of the final project report (10% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor and Defense Board), conducted in Week 12.

Syllabus.Heading: Poster Presentation for Peer Review
Syllabus.Description: Poster presentation for peer review (5% of marks, based on Visitors' Feedback), conducted in Week 13.

Syllabus.Heading: Final Defense and Demonstration
Syllabus.Description: Final defense and project demonstration (10% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor and Defense Board; Project itself is 20% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor and Defense Board), conducted in Week 14.

Syllabus.Heading: Submission of Amended Final Report
Syllabus.Description: Submission of the amended final report, conducted within the first week after the final examination.

Syllabus.Heading: Submission of Progress Report and Presentation
Syllabus.Description: Submission of progress report (10% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor and Defense Board) and progress presentation (5% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor and Defense Board), conducted in Week 14.

Syllabus.Heading: Background of Cloud Computing
Syllabus.Description: Distributed systems, issues in distributed systems, Basic Computing Paradigms.

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction to Cloud Computing
Syllabus.Description: Definition and applications including benefits, challenges, and risks, historical overview, Enabling Technologies and System Models for Cloud Computing.

Syllabus.Heading: Cloud Computing Architecture and Management
Syllabus.Description: Architectural design of Cloud computing, cloud service models (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS, XaaS).

Syllabus.Heading: Cloud Computing Architecture and Management
Syllabus.Description: Types of clouds (Public, Private, Hybrid, Community clouds).

Syllabus.Heading: Cloud Resource Virtualization
Syllabus.Description: Resource virtualization and virtual machine, file virtualization, types of virtualization, hardware/software support.

Syllabus.Heading: Cloud Resource Virtualization
Syllabus.Description: Network virtualization, performance of virtual machines, VM software and platforms, hypervisors, OS-level virtualization, Docker.

Syllabus.Heading: Cloud Resource Management and Scheduling
Syllabus.Description: Cloud Computing Reference Architecture, policies and mechanisms, resource utilization and energy efficiency.

Syllabus.Heading: Cloud Resource Management and Scheduling
Syllabus.Description: Application resource management, models for cloud-based web services, scheduling algorithms.

Syllabus.Heading: Cloud Storage
Syllabus.Description: Overview of storage systems and models, Distributed File Systems, Cloud Databases, Data storage for online transaction processing systems.

Syllabus.Heading: Cloud Security
Syllabus.Description: Cloud-security risks, Privacy and trust on the cloud, Cloud data encryption, Security of cloud infrastructure.

Syllabus.Heading: Cloud Platforms
Syllabus.Description: Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google App Engine, Google MapReduce, Yahoo Hadoop, Eucalyptus, Nimbus, OpenStack, etc.

Syllabus.Heading: Mobile Cloud Computing
Syllabus.Description: Architecture and applications of MCC, Code partitioning, Code offloading, VM migration techniques.

Syllabus.Heading: Emergent Trends and Practices
Syllabus.Description: Hybrid Multicloud, Serverless Computing, Microservices, Virtual Desktop Infrastructure, Desktop as a Service.

Syllabus.Heading: Emergent Trends and Practices
Syllabus.Description: Future Cloud Computing Architectures, Edge computing, Fog Computing.

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction to Secure Software Development and Software Security Principles
Syllabus.Description: Overview of Secure Software Development principles and practices, Understanding the importance of security in software development, Introduction to Software Security Principles and their significance in building resilient applications.

Syllabus.Heading: Secure Coding Fundamentals and Software Assessment Methods
Syllabus.Description: Deep dive into secure coding practices, Understanding Software Assessment Methods and Techniques for identifying vulnerabilities, Hands-on exercises to implement secure coding practices and conduct basic software assessments.

Syllabus.Heading: Data Validation Techniques and Vulnerability Classification
Syllabus.Description: In-depth exploration of Data Validation techniques to prevent injection attacks (e.g., SQL injection, XSS), Hands-on exercises to implement input validation in web and mobile applications.

Syllabus.Heading: Session Management and Exception Handling
Syllabus.Description: Best practices for secure session management to prevent session hijacking and fixation, Strategies for robust exception handling to prevent information leakage and denial of service attacks.

Syllabus.Heading: Data Encryption and Cryptography, and Software Attack Surface
Syllabus.Description: Introduction to Data Encryption techniques and Cryptography for protecting sensitive data, Understanding Software Attack Surface and techniques to reduce attack surface area, Hands-on exercises to implement data encryption and assess software attack surface.

Syllabus.Heading: Application Security Configuration
Syllabus.Description: Understanding secure configuration management of application web servers, middleware, and databases, Implementing secure configurations to mitigate common vulnerabilities (e.g., default credentials, misconfigurations).

Syllabus.Heading: Policy Requirements for Secure Development
Syllabus.Description: Reviewing policy-specific requirements necessary for implementing a secure development program within enterprise organizations, Understanding compliance standards such as PCI DSS, HIPAA, GDPR, etc.

Syllabus.Heading: Secure Software Design Principles
Syllabus.Description: Incorporating security in requirements engineering and design phases, Conducting risk analysis and threat modeling to identify potential security risks.

Syllabus.Heading: Defensive Coding Techniques
Syllabus.Description: Exploring defensive coding techniques to mitigate common vulnerabilities (e.g., buffer overflows, insecure deserialization), Hands-on exercises to implement defensive coding practices in real-world scenarios.

Syllabus.Heading: Penetration Testing and Vulnerability Assessment
Syllabus.Description: Introduction to penetration testing methodologies and tools, Conducting vulnerability assessments to identify and remediate security vulnerabilities in software applications.

Syllabus.Heading: Fuzzing and Static Analysis
Syllabus.Description: Understanding fuzzing techniques for identifying software vulnerabilities through automated testing, Utilizing static analysis tools for identifying security flaws in source code.

Syllabus.Heading: Security Assessment and Post-Deployment Security
Syllabus.Description: Conducting comprehensive security assessments to evaluate the security posture of software applications, Implementing post-deployment security measures such as security monitoring and incident response.

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction to Software Maintenance
Syllabus.Description: Overview of software maintenance, Importance and significance, Types of maintenance: corrective, adaptive, perfective, preventive.

Syllabus.Heading: Software Maintenance Process
Syllabus.Description: Software maintenance lifecycle, Maintenance activities and phases, Role of maintenance in the overall software development process.

Syllabus.Heading: Tools and Techniques for Software Maintenance
Syllabus.Description: Introduction to version control systems, Using issue tracking systems, Automated testing frameworks.

Syllabus.Heading: Prioritizing Maintenance Tasks
Syllabus.Description: Techniques for prioritization (e.g., Impact vs. Effort matrix), Factors influencing task prioritization, Case studies and exercises on task prioritization.

Syllabus.Heading: Debugging Techniques
Syllabus.Description: Introduction to debugging, Debugging tools and methodologies, Debugging exercises and best practices.

Syllabus.Heading: Code Refactoring
Syllabus.Description: Understanding code refactoring, Impact of refactoring on software maintenance.

Syllabus.Heading: Code Refactoring and Optimization
Syllabus.Description: Techniques for code optimization, Impact of refactoring on software maintenance.

Syllabus.Heading: Managing Software Dependencies
Syllabus.Description: Identifying and managing external dependencies, Techniques for handling dependency issues, Case studies on dependency management.

Syllabus.Heading: Documentation and Communication
Syllabus.Description: Importance of documentation in maintenance, Types of maintenance documentation, Effective communication within maintenance teams.

Syllabus.Heading: Software Evolution and Legacy Systems
Syllabus.Description: Understanding software evolution, Challenges and strategies for maintaining legacy systems, Modernizing and migrating legacy systems.

Syllabus.Heading: Security and Ethical Considerations
Syllabus.Description: Security vulnerabilities in maintenance, Ethical responsibilities of software maintainers, Ensuring data privacy and integrity maintenance activities.

Syllabus.Heading: Software Maintenance Metrics
Syllabus.Description: Key performance indicators (KPIs) for maintenance, Metrics for measuring maintenance effectiveness, Using metrics to improve maintenance processes.

Syllabus.Heading: Continuous Integration and Deployment
Syllabus.Description: Introduction to CI/CD pipelines, Automating deployment processes, Integration of maintenance into CI/CD workflows.

Syllabus.Heading: Final Project and Review
Syllabus.Description: Students work on a final project applying concepts learned throughout the course, Presentation of final projects.

Subjects.SubjectName: BIM 317 : Business Analytics and Decision Making

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction to Data Analysis and Decision-Making
Syllabus.Description: Introduction, Modeling and Models, A Seven-Step Modeling Process.

Syllabus.Heading: Exploring Data
Syllabus.Description: Describing the Distribution of a Single Variable, Populations and Samples, Data Sets, Variables, and Observations, Types of Data, Descriptive Measures for Categorical Variables and Numerical Variables, Time Series Data, Outliers and Missing Values, Excel Tables for Filtering, Sorting, and Summarizing.

Syllabus.Heading: Finding Relationships among Variables
Syllabus.Description: Relationships among Categorical Variables, Stacked and Unstacked Formats, Relationships among Numerical Variables, Scatterplots, Correlation and Covariance, Pivot Tables.

Syllabus.Heading: Probability and Probability Distribution
Syllabus.Description: Probability essentials, Probability Distribution of a Single Random Variable, Introduction to Simulation, The Normal Distribution, Applications of the Normal Distribution, The Binomial Distribution, Applications of the Binomial Distribution, The Poisson and Exponential Distribution.

Syllabus.Heading: Decision-Making Under Uncertainty
Syllabus.Description: Elements of Decision Analysis, The Precision Tree Add-In, Bayes' Rule, Multistage Decision Problems and the Value of Information, Risk Aversion and Expected Utility.

Syllabus.Heading: Statistical Inference
Syllabus.Description: Sampling and Sampling Distributions, Sampling Terminology, Methods for Selecting Random Samples, Introduction to Estimation, Sampling Distributions, Confidence Interval for a Mean, Total, Proportion and Standard Deviation, Confidence Interval for the Difference Between Means and Proportions, Sample Size Selection.

Syllabus.Heading: Hypothesis Testing
Syllabus.Description: Concepts in Hypothesis Testing, Types of Errors, Significance Level and Rejection Region, Hypothesis Tests and Confidence Intervals, Hypothesis Tests for Other Parameters, Tests for Normality, Chi-Square Test for Independence.

Syllabus.Heading: Case Studies and Practical Implementations
Syllabus.Description: Case studies of Decision Making Using Decision Support Systems, Hands-on Exercises with Excel data management tools, Potential Applications of Decision Tools including RISK, StatTools, Precision Tree, etc., Practical Implementation of Data Mining and Data Management Software Tools Like SPSS, Strata, etc.

Subjects.SubjectName: BIM 317 (lab) : Business Analytics and Decision Making

Syllabus.Heading: Supervisor and Topic Selection
Syllabus.Description: Application for Thesis Supervisor Selection and Topic and Supervisor selection, to be completed before the start of the 7th semester.

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction and Briefing
Syllabus.Description: Introduction to the Undergraduate Thesis, including objectives and expectations, conducted in Week 1.

Syllabus.Heading: Team Formation and Project Area Selection
Syllabus.Description: Formation of project teams and selection of project area, conducted in Week 2.

Syllabus.Heading: Conduct Investigation/Literature Review
Syllabus.Description: Conducting a literature review on the selected topic to establish the thesis foundation, conducted in Weeks 6-8.

Syllabus.Heading: Set Project Plan and Strategy
Syllabus.Description: Developing a project plan and strategy, including timelines and deliverables, conducted in Weeks 9-10.

Syllabus.Heading: Preparation of Project Proposal
Syllabus.Description: Drafting the thesis proposal outlining the scope, objectives, and methodology, conducted in Week 11.

Syllabus.Heading: Proposal Submission and Pre-Viva
Syllabus.Description: Submission of the thesis proposal and pre-viva evaluation by the supervisor (5% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor), conducted in Week 12.

Syllabus.Heading: Review and Correction of Proposal
Syllabus.Description: Reviewing feedback and making corrections to the thesis proposal, conducted in Week 13.

Syllabus.Heading: Document Preparation
Syllabus.Description: Preparing thesis documentation, including progress reports and other required materials, conducted in Week 14.

Syllabus.Heading: Submission of Progress Report and Presentation
Syllabus.Description: Submission of progress report (10% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor) and progress presentation (5% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor and Defense Board). Continuous Assessment (30% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor) and Log Book (5% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor) are also part of the evaluation, conducted in Week 14.

Terms.SubjectName: AI 483 : Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning

Syllabus.Heading: Intelligent Agents and their Environments
Syllabus.Description: The concept of a Rational Agent, Specifying the Task environment (PEAS description), Different characteristics of environments (Fully vs Partially observable, Static vs Dynamic, Episodic vs Sequential, etc.) and Different types of agents (Reflex, Goal-based, Utility-based, etc.).

Syllabus.Heading: Adversarial Search
Syllabus.Description: Formulation of a Game tree, The minimax algorithm, Alpha-Beta pruning.

Syllabus.Heading: Probabilistic Reasoning
Syllabus.Description: Bayes' rule and its uses, Bayesian Network: Building a Bayes-net and making inference from it, Hidden Markov Model.

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction to Machine Learning Concepts
Syllabus.Description: Machine learning strategy - Supervised, Unsupervised, Semi-supervised, and Reinforcement Learning, Parametric and Non-parametric models, Maximum likelihood estimation.

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction to Machine Learning Concepts
Syllabus.Description: Gradient Descent and types, Cost Functions, Regularization, Normalization and Optimization, Bias-Variance Tradeoff, Overfitting & Underfitting, Many-fold learning.

Syllabus.Heading: Introductory Machine Learning Models
Syllabus.Description: Linear Regression and Inference, Logistic Regression.

Syllabus.Heading: Introductory Machine Learning Models
Syllabus.Description: Latent Discriminant Analysis, Decision Tree & Random Forest.

Syllabus.Heading: Introductory Machine Learning Models
Syllabus.Description: K-means clustering, Agglomerative Clustering.

Syllabus.Heading: Deep Learning
Syllabus.Description: Multilayer perceptron - XOR problem, Activation Functions, Back-propagation, Connecting neuro-biology. Neural Network for Structured Data: Artificial Feed-Forward Neural Network, vanishing and exploding gradients, catastrophic forgetting, residual connection, early stopping, weight decay, dropout.

Syllabus.Heading: Neural Network for Images Data
Syllabus.Description: Common Layers - Convolutional layers, Pooling layers. Typical architecture - VGG-16, ResNet, InceptionNet, GAN. Application in Real Life: Object detection, Image Tagging, Segmentation.

Syllabus.Heading: Neural Network for Sequence Data
Syllabus.Description: Recurrent Neural Network - Backpropagation through time, Gating and long-term memory, Attention Mechanism. Typical Architectures - LSTM, GRU, Transformer.

Syllabus.Heading: Dimensionality Reduction
Syllabus.Description: Curse of Dimension, PCA, t-sne, Embedding mechanism concept.

Syllabus.Heading: Advanced Concepts
Syllabus.Description: Bagging, Boosting, Ensemble Learning, Data imbalance problem.

Syllabus.Heading: Advanced Concepts
Syllabus.Description: Machine Learning in Graph, KL divergence, Feature selection, Few-shot and n-shot learning, Meta-learning, Transfer-learning, Feature Engineering Concepts, Project.

Terms.SubjectName: AI 483 (lab) : Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning

Syllabus.Heading: Technical Reporting
Syllabus.Description: Technical writing procedures and proposals, strategic plans and plannings.

Syllabus.Heading: Publishing Works
Syllabus.Description: Type of works should be published and why to publish certain chosen work, open access publishing and self-publishing.

Syllabus.Heading: Rules for E-media
Syllabus.Description: E-mail, E-newsletter, blogging, E-magazines.

Syllabus.Heading: Writing with Collaborators
Syllabus.Description: Writing in different voices, Collaborative writing projects.

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction of Academic Writing
Syllabus.Description: Basics of Academic Writing, Characteristics of Good Academic Writing, Academic Writing Process.

Syllabus.Heading: Titles and Headings
Syllabus.Description: Heading and Title, Academic Languages.

Syllabus.Heading: Types of Academic Writings I
Syllabus.Description: LAB Report Writing, Research Paper Writing.

Syllabus.Heading: Types of Academic Writings II
Syllabus.Description: Research Proposal, Literature Review.

Syllabus.Heading: Types of Academic Writings III
Syllabus.Description: Thesis, Dissertation.

Syllabus.Heading: Finalize the Methodology
Syllabus.Description: Finalizing the thesis methodology, including research and development approaches, conducted in Weeks 1-2. Continuous Assessment (30% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor) applies.

Syllabus.Heading: Development and Implementation of Project Prototype
Syllabus.Description: Developing and implementing the thesis prototype, conducted in Weeks 3-4. Continuous Assessment (30% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor) and Log Book (5% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor) are part of the evaluation.

Syllabus.Heading: Field Work/Data Collection/Analysis/Related Software Development
Syllabus.Description: Conducting field work, data collection, analysis, and related software development, conducted in Weeks 5-8. Continuous Assessment (30% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor) and Log Book (5% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor) apply.

Syllabus.Heading: Project Fine Tuning
Syllabus.Description: Fine-tuning the thesis project based on initial results and feedback, conducted in Weeks 9-10. Continuous Assessment (30% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor) applies.

Syllabus.Heading: Report Writing
Syllabus.Description: Writing the thesis report, documenting methodology, findings, and analysis, conducted in Weeks 1-10. Continuous Assessment (30% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor) applies.

Syllabus.Heading: Submission of Draft Report and Pre-review
Syllabus.Description: Submission of the draft thesis report and pre-review by the supervisor, conducted in Week 11. Continuous Assessment (30% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor) applies.

Syllabus.Heading: Submission of Final Report
Syllabus.Description: Submission of the final thesis report (10% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor and Defense Board), conducted in Week 12.

Syllabus.Heading: Poster Presentation for Peer Review
Syllabus.Description: Poster presentation for peer review (5% of marks, based on Visitors' Feedback), conducted in Week 13.

Syllabus.Heading: Final Defense and Demonstration
Syllabus.Description: Final defense and thesis demonstration (10% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor and Defense Board; Project itself is 20% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor and Defense Board), conducted in Week 14.

Syllabus.Heading: Submission of Amended Final Report
Syllabus.Description: Submission of the amended final thesis report, conducted within the first week after the final examination.

Syllabus.Heading: Submission of Progress Report and Presentation
Syllabus.Description: Submission of progress report (10% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor) and progress presentation (5% of marks, evaluated by Supervisor and Defense Board), conducted in Week 14.

Syllabus.Heading: Introduction to Ethics
Syllabus.Description: Morals and ethics, Comparison of ethics and engineering ethics, Ethics at personal and student level.

Syllabus.Heading: The Concept of Professions
Syllabus.Description: The importance of ethics in science and engineering, The role of codes of ethics, Professional responsibilities of software engineers.

Syllabus.Heading: The Concept of Morality
Syllabus.Description: The importance of core values, Moral/ethical dilemmas and hierarchy of moral values, Factors affecting moral responsibility, and degrees of responsibility.

Syllabus.Heading: Overview of Ethical Theories and Applications
Syllabus.Description: Overview of ethical theories and their applications in software engineering.

Syllabus.Heading: Basics of Ethical Analyses and Decision-Making
Syllabus.Description: Fundamentals of ethical analyses and decision-making processes in professional settings.

Syllabus.Heading: The Importance of Intention
Syllabus.Description: Truth (personal and social), The concept of whistleblowing, Ethical leadership in engineering and society, Conflicts of interests.

Syllabus.Heading: Engineering Ethics in Organizations
Syllabus.Description: Ethics in the workplace, Fairness (personal and social).

Syllabus.Heading: Case Studies on Ethics for Software Engineers
Syllabus.Description: Analyzing real-world case studies to understand ethical challenges and decision-making in software engineering.

Syllabus.Heading: Ethical Issues Related to Software Requirements
Syllabus.Description: Exploring ethical considerations in gathering and defining software requirements.

Syllabus.Heading: Ethical Issues Related to Software Design
Syllabus.Description: Examining ethical implications in software design decisions and their impact on users and society.

Syllabus.Heading: Ethical Issues Related to Software Testing
Syllabus.Description: Understanding ethical responsibilities in ensuring software quality and reliability through testing.

Syllabus.Heading: Ethical Issues Related to Software Maintenance
Syllabus.Description: Addressing ethical challenges in maintaining and updating software systems.

Syllabus.Heading: Ethical Issues Related to Software Project Management
Syllabus.Description: Exploring ethical considerations in managing software projects, including resource allocation and stakeholder communication.

Syllabus.Heading: Strategy Formulation
Syllabus.Description: Strategy Formulation, Strategy Execution, Organizational Structure.

Syllabus.Heading: Concept of Communication
Syllabus.Description: Basic types of communication, Techniques of effective communication, Barriers of communication.

Syllabus.Heading: Leadership and Team Building
Syllabus.Description: Leadership concept, types, attributes of a successful leader, team-building concept, salient features of a team, and basic stages of team building.

Syllabus.Heading: Critical Thinking and Decision Making
Syllabus.Description: Critical thinking, convergent thinking, divergent thinking, problem identifying, Managerial decision making.

Syllabus.Heading: Sustainable Business Plan
Syllabus.Description: Sustainable business plan, business models for sustainable development.

Syllabus.Heading: Developing a Business Proposal
Syllabus.Description: Concept of business proposal, methods of business proposal, Industry and Market Research.

Syllabus.Heading: Human Resource Management
Syllabus.Description: Basic elements of HRM.

Syllabus.Heading: Manpower Planning and Regulatory Law
Syllabus.Description: Manpower planning, recruitment, training and development, remuneration and benefits, regulatory law.

Syllabus.Heading: Recap and Course Completion
Syllabus.Description: Recap and course completion session.
